Meet our new, unique cabin textiles from @Marimekkoglobal: a neck pillow and beautiful woven blanket with Marimekko prints to bring extra comfort and joy. The new items are specially designed for the Premium Economy seat to elevate your travel experience. https://t.co/hIO2tJAfoQ
https://t.co/xrSfEuRWKW In Q4, travel increased and EBITDA turned positive. Omicron caused a short detour. Read more from our Investor Relations blog.

urls.title: Photo tour: Step inside Finnair’s new Premium Economy cabin
urls.description: Sitting comfortably in a cabin of its own between Business and Economy Class, our new Premium Economy cabin has cutting edge Nordic design at its heart. In Premium Economy, the seats offer 40% more space than in Economy Class, affording extra room to relax and enjoy the best that Finnair has to offer on a long haul trip to Asia or the United States. With a comfortable seat recline, a leg rest that supports the entire leg and memory foam cushions to ensure maximum comfort, it’s the perfect way to travel

data.text:
Curious about our new travel class, Premium Economy? Step inside: https://t.co/huehppBrZK
The sales will start on 1 March.

During 2021, travel increased and EBITDA turned positive; Omicron’s negative impact was notable but short-term. Read Finnair Financial Statements Release 1 January–31 December 2021 here: https://t.co/qu1WSQRXjS https://t.co/aPfYpdhrws

urls.title: New cabin
urls.description: Experience the new sensation of flying with Finnair. Our redesigned long-haul cabin will elevate your travel experience to a whole new level.

data.text: The new Iittala Kuulas tableware designed by Harri Koskinen creates a moment of Nordic living in the air. Each piece of the collection has been designed to elevate your dining experience and reduce the overall weight on board on our new long-haul cabins. https://t.co/azubqOuzLr https://t.co/tyAXbIagky
Finnair cabin crew’s strike has been cancelled. A new collective labour agreement has been reached today for the Finnair cabin crew in Finland. https://t.co/6AyYrrIdxl

data.text: Is your skiing trip coming up? We recommend you do check-in in advance to get a smooth start to your journey. It’s also a good idea to get to know the baggage instructions, especially if you are packing your ski equipment. See our tips for smooth travels: https://t.co/IATVeFVisU https://t.co/MQNNgNhfxz

In our renewed Business Class, you’ll discover an enhanced home-like space, which allows you to relax, work or rest during your long-haul travel – the choice is yours. Subtle mood lighting is designed to create a calm atmosphere throughout the cabin. https://t.co/51vfDHmryH https://t.co/SP5YCTkIFs

urls.title: Travelling to Finland
urls.description: Finland has opened for travel from the EU and Schengen countries. Travel from outside of the EU and Schengen area remains restricted. Finnish authorities define the entry requirements to Finland. See more detailed instructions below. Please also note that travel restrictions are subject to change at short notice. As a traveller, you are always responsible for ensuring that you fulfil the requirements of your destination and possible transit country. You can check the current entry restrictions to Finland

data.text: Good news for travellers hoping to come to Finland from outside of the EU and the Schengen area! Travelling has eased for fully vaccinated people as of today 15 Feb, and a pre-test is no longer needed. Check more detailed instructions: https://t.co/88kb8fWfp4 https://t.co/QW6Y9MguDX

Confirm your coronavirus related documents before your journey with our pre-check my certificates tool when checking in in advance online or through the Finnair app. The new feature allows you to upload your documents for a pre-check. Read more: https://t.co/mUFDqnGGPX https://t.co/WxZTrEnCuS

urls.title: Finnair Lounges at Helsinki Airport
urls.description: Combining Nordic design, atmosphere and hospitality, our lounges at Helsinki Airport invite you to spend a hassle-free moment before your flight. There are three lounges at Helsinki Airport – Finnair Lounge in the Schengen side and Finnair Business Lounge and Finnair Platinum Wing in the non-Schengen side of the airport.

data.text: From today onwards, our Finnair Lounges at Helsinki Airport are open normally: Finnair Lounge in the Schengen area from 5.30 a.m. to 11.30 p.m. and Finnair Business Lounge in the non-Schengen area from 6 a.m. until midnight. Welcome for a visit! https://t.co/UzI3bxjLBg

In our Business Class, you’ll find the very best in premium Nordic design, from the incredible Finnair exclusive Collins’ AirLounge seat to a transformative new design language that ties together our Finnair Lounges and departure hall at Helsinki Airport. https://t.co/K0OPGGAAat

Our Business Class is the embodiment of Finnair. A signature premium Nordic experience down to the very last detail. Designed to maximise your travel comfort and respect your privacy on board. Discover more at https://t.co/51vfDHmryH. https://t.co/f8YeKaG8Yi

urls.title: New cabin
urls.description: Experience the new sensation of flying with Finnair. Our redesigned long-haul cabin will elevate your travel experience to a whole new level.

data.text: Discover an enhanced home-like space with the entirely new Collins’ AirLounge seat in the redesigned Business Class: functional stowage features and amplified personal space and privacy. We’d love to hear what your favourite features are? https://t.co/azubqOuzLr https://t.co/ZIEGz7bsy3

data.text: David Kondo has worked with the elevated long-haul experience project from the very beginning and has headed the product design. He introduced the new Business Class AirLounge seat, the product of years of work in collaboration with the design experts at @CollinsAero. https://t.co/uVc604cwhk

@TopiManner, Finnair’s CEO stated: “I am extremely proud to say that we are today unveiling the work of a very dedicated team of people who have been putting their heart and their soul into defining what the long-haul experience at Finnair should be.” https://t.co/Nh1m2WhFE3

Today’s online press conference was hosted from our beautiful Platinum Wing Lounge at Helsinki Airport where @paivyttallqvist, Finnair’s Senior Vice President, Communications warmly welcomed our listeners to hear more about our new elevated long-haul experience. https://t.co/7AFwF8IhV2

We hope you are sharing our excitement and smiles when seeing our new elevated long-haul experience. Watch a 30-minute recording of today’s press event here: https://t.co/70bO1DImEf https://t.co/NoW7cRHFdW

data.text: On your next visit to iconic New York City, what about packing trekking boots and escaping from the city to mountain lakes or rugged coastal hills of the Atlantic Ocean? Check out our pilot’s tips for nearby located Montauk and Bear Mountain State Park: https://t.co/Ce5ESiC1QH https://t.co/tVW5g3Gasn

In January, Finnair carried 451,300 passengers, which was 427.3% more than in January 2021. The number of passengers in January 2022 was 25.1% less than in December 2021.  https://t.co/otD2qdgV5l https://t.co/mLidb7K98N

In Manage booking, you can view and change your booking, and customise your travel experience with travel extras. Read our article to find out what features we currently offer in the service, and what kind of development plans we have for the future: https://t.co/I30SAx4PwD

urls.title: Finnair timetables
urls.description: Check the Finnair flight timetables in a calendar view and see the flight numbers, frequencies and other details.

data.text: We have published a new Timetables page on our website, where you can easily check which days and what times we fly to certain destinations and how many daily flights we might have. Check out the page at https://t.co/mPVNVYqN9U. https://t.co/YGZ0Vpq2zf

The big winter games in Beijing are starting soon, and we want to wish the best of luck to all the athletes competing in them! Check out our Blue Wings story to find out what are some of the winter sports you can try yourself when visiting Finland: https://t.co/N8Kpl0YtFA

urls.title: Change your booking flexibly
urls.description: With our updated ticket policy, you can now change your travel dates with more flexibility. Book Finnair flights and travel with confidence!

data.text: We have extended our flexible booking policy so that you can book flights and make your travel plans worry-free. Until 31 May 2022, you can change your travel dates as many times as you wish. After that, you can still make one additional change. https://t.co/NQN3hfqxdl

data.text: Finland's restaurant restrictions are changing again. Thus, as of today, Helsinki Airport's Finnair Lounge in the Schengen side is open at 5.30 am–9 pm and Finnair Business Lounge in the non-Schengen side at 6 am–9 pm. Serving alcohol ends at 8 pm.  https://t.co/UzI3bxjLBg https://t.co/oeV3Q9hwtH

urls.title: Travelling to Finland
urls.description: Finland has opened for travel from the EU and Schengen countries. Travel from outside of the EU and Schengen area remains restricted. Finnish authorities define the entry requirements to Finland. See more detailed instructions below. Please also note that travel restrictions are subject to change at short notice. As a traveller, you are always responsible for ensuring that you fulfil the requirements of your destination and possible transit country. You can check the current entry restrictions to Finland

data.text: As of today, you can arrive in Finland from the EU and/or Schengen countries freely without quarantine or test upon arrival when you are fully vaccinated or fulfil another condition defined in the Communicable Diseases Act. Read more at https://t.co/88kb8fWfp4. https://t.co/BwYOXXFjDP

data.text: Happy New Year to our friends in Asia! We wish you lots of happiness, success and wealth for the upcoming year of the tiger and hope to see you very soon! https://t.co/9vXcxFjKUD

urls.title: Travel updates
urls.description: Helsinki Airport is the ideal place to start and finish your journey. All flights depart from and arrive in one terminal. We currently have delays in the refund handling due to a higher than normally volume of refund applications. Finnair leases an A320 aircraft from DAT LT from 20 June to 29 October 2022. Wearing a mask on our flights is optional, unless it is required by the authorities of your destination or origin country. We collected tips for you for smooth travelling during the busy summer season.

data.text: Where should you head for a relaxing beach holiday in guaranteed warmth right now? Where can you spend a more active holiday under the sun? And where to explore the local villages in a pleasant climate? Check out our top five winter sun destinations: https://t.co/xSFYNkNdjc https://t.co/7xSE6bjqM2

urls.title: Smooth travelling at Helsinki Airport
urls.description: Flying via Helsinki means that you can enjoy the compact and uncrowded Helsinki Airport, where all the gates and services are located under one roof, in one terminal building. Helsinki Airport welcomes you with its new spacious arrival and departure halls! As the main transit area for Finnair customers, the brand-new terminal will make connections extra quick and smooth. Catching a train, bus or taxi to or from the airport is now easier than ever as everything is nearby the terminal entrance. The

data.text: The renewed Helsinki Airport’s Terminal 2 opened at the beginning of December – have you already seen it? Finnair departure hall services are gradually moving to the new building, while the new arrivals hall is open already now: https://t.co/pbtG4v5GH3. Smooth travels! https://t.co/xXE1gH04cS

Due to corona related restrictions for restaurants, our lounges at Helsinki Airport close at 6 pm and serving alcohol ends at 5 pm. These restrictions are valid until 15 February. The restrictions also affect other restaurant services at Helsinki Airport: https://t.co/jaIikLFCRa https://t.co/q9je9Pf2Rk

data.text: Thailand opens again for fully vaccinated travellers from around the world from 1 February onwards. You can travel to Thailand quarantine-free under the Test&Go programme provided that you meet the travel requirements. Read more: https://t.co/gxg7w5xj1J https://t.co/UHIyFcRHWk

urls.title: Nature experiences, well-being, and snow adventures in Lapland
urls.description: Lapland is at its best in the spring side of winter. There is no lack of snowy slopes, and the days are growing longer and sunnier. The different resorts offer plenty to choose from, whether you are a keen sportsperson, looking for local flavours, wanting to try out new activities or just need to rewind in nature. Ivalo is the travel center of Northern Lapland; it has the most nort hern airport in the EU as well as great services such as hotels and restaurants. Ivalo is known for its truly unique nature

data.text: Let us introduce our magical northern destinations: Ivalo, Kittilä, Rovaniemi and Kuusamo! Read our story to find out where is your best bet to see the Northern Lights, where the skiing season usually lasts the longest and where to visit Santa Claus: https://t.co/J8npcw3xgS

data.text: Check your destination’s travel requirements easily in the travel restrictions map on our website: https://t.co/XzcJck2y1i. The same map is used by our customer service. We currently get exceptionally many calls and are unable to answer questions regarding travel restrictions. https://t.co/0LwnlXR5jL
You can see the current opening hours of Helsinki Airport's restaurants here: https://t.co/QhWwv6ZPoW

urls.title: Pre-order meals
urls.description: Make the most of your time in the air with Finnair's pre-order sandwiches and tasty hot meals for Economy Class flights.

data.text: Due to Finland’s current restrictions, also other restaurant services at Helsinki Airport along with the Finnair Lounges are currently restricted and close by 6 p.m. To avoid hunger, you can pre-order a sandwich for your flight: https://t.co/6k6wX12DaG.

Have you already used Finnair app? Our app is designed to give you peace of mind on the move. Book and customise your flight with travel extras, check in for your flight, check your flight and gate information and have your Finnair Plus card with you. https://t.co/SBLAfDfEIq

Due to the current pandemic situation and restrictions in Finland and globally, we have decided to slightly postpone the unveiling of our fully renewed long-haul cabin that was originally planned for January. Stay tuned, we look forward to telling you more as soon as possible. https://t.co/SpTcQf2SXs

data.text: Are you travelling from Finland to Austria, Belgium, Czech Republic, Greece, Latvia, Lithuania, the Netherlands, Norway or Spain? You can confirm your coronavirus certificates before your journey when checking in online or through the Finnair app: https://t.co/mUFDqnGGPX https://t.co/gpB7NfTM4e

Changes to our long-haul flights: The start of our new Dallas service will move to March 27. The start of Nagoya flights and added frequencies to Osaka will move to the summer season. https://t.co/QeKkKieBxS

data.text: We are reducing our traffic programme in Feb by 20% as increasing sick leaves take their toll. The majority of the cancelled flights are on routes where we operate multiple daily flights, so we can usually offer an alternative flight on the same day. https://t.co/QeKkKieBxS https://t.co/pz7NwpiUyo

urls.title: Finnair Lounges at Helsinki Airport
urls.description: Combining Nordic design, atmosphere and hospitality, our lounges at Helsinki Airport invite you to spend a hassle-free moment before your flight. There are three lounges at Helsinki Airport – Finnair Lounge in the Schengen side and Finnair Business Lounge and Finnair Platinum Wing in the non-Schengen side of the airport.

data.text: As there are new and stricter restrictions for restaurants in Finland, we will need to close the Finnair Lounges at Helsinki Airport at 6 p.m. The alcohol service ends at 5 p.m. These opening hours are valid as of today and until the end of January. https://t.co/UzI3bxjLBg https://t.co/1r4hVgsHTA

Please note that everyone over 7 years old is still required to wear a mask on our flights. You can choose a surgical mask, a valveless FFP2 or FFP3 mask or another kind of valveless mask following the equivalent standards (N95). https://t.co/c9LWBZrZrT https://t.co/aKRW16fov5

The Regional State Administrative Agency for Southern Finland (AVI) has ruled that the current restrictions that apply to restaurants in Finland, also apply for Finnair and Norra’s domestic flights. Thus, we cannot sell alcoholic beverages on our domestic flights after 5 p.m. https://t.co/thoVpRB7yq
If you are required to take a coronavirus test before your trip, we recommend you take it as close to the departure as possible.

data.text: We have been forced to cancel some flights, as the omicron variant and the flu season are causing increased sickness absences in Finnair and our partners' teams. If your flight were to be disrupted, we will contact you via SMS and/or e-mail. Read more at https://t.co/50Gh15CziM. https://t.co/9VDgHflAd8

data.text: We have updated the prices of Finnair coronavirus tests. Finnair rapid antigen test is now €65 for Finnair passengers and €79 for other customers, and Finnair PCR test is now €93 for Finnair’s passengers and €120 for other customers. https://t.co/LzGZBYEgSs

In December, Finnair carried 602,700 passengers, which was 551.4% more than in December 2020. The number of passengers in December 2021 was 23.8% more than in November 2021. https://t.co/EvO9keDOTI https://t.co/H2isEByBlc

Are you returning home from the holidays? We recommend you do the check-in in advance and arrive at the airport early to get a smooth start to your journey back home. See also our other tips: https://t.co/T4Ou9Xeze9 https://t.co/NANkkcSMtY

entity.name: Travel Actions
entity.description: This entity includes all conversations about travel and vacation.

data.text: Dreaming of a skiing holiday in Central Europe? Find out what is a great destination when travelling with kids, and where you can find Europe’s steepest slopes with breathtaking views. Check out our tips for Germany, Austria and Switzerland: https://t.co/v5nEs926Gn

We apologise for the delays in baggage handling at Helsinki Airport, and we are working hard together with our ground handling partner to improve the situation. If your baggage didn’t arrive with you, please make a report and we'll deliver it to you: https://t.co/9ywnszjfyA. https://t.co/69Xz25pjYt

urls.title: Travelling to Finland
urls.description: Finland has opened for travel from the EU and Schengen countries. Travel from outside of the EU and Schengen area remains restricted. Finnish authorities define the entry requirements to Finland. See more detailed instructions below. Please also note that travel restrictions are subject to change at short notice. As a traveller, you are always responsible for ensuring that you fulfil the requirements of your destination and possible transit country. You can check the current entry restrictions to Finland

data.text: The pre-test is not required for Finnish citizens or residents, travellers arriving in the country for an essential reason or travellers connecting to an international flight in Helsinki. More information will be updated here: https://t.co/10LbEoil5S

Entry requirements to Finland change when arriving from the EU or Schengen area between 28 December and 16 January. Please present a negative coronavirus test result taken earliest 48 h before arrival in addition to a vaccination or recovery certificate. https://t.co/DIw86tn3kk
However, if you have already received your Thailand Pass QR code, you can enter Thailand under the scheme.

urls.title: Travel requirements map
urls.description: Use the interactive travel map to find out where you can fly with Finnair and what guidelines you need to follow in each destination.

data.text: Thailand is changing its travel requirements as of 22 December. Applying for new Thailand Passes, except under the Phuket sandbox model, is no longer possible. The second RT-PCR test is required within 6-7 days after arrival. See what’s required at https://t.co/gFcDo9W37x https://t.co/PuL5p0q4ek

You can now order Nordic Kitchen onboard menu products via our inflight entertainment system and pay them securely using your own mobile device. This service awarded with the international Red Dot design award is available for you on most of our intercontinental flights. https://t.co/pg0KzjWdSG

Please note that everyone over 7 years old is still required to wear a mask on our flights. You can choose a surgical mask, a valveless FFP2 or FFP3 mask or another kind of valveless mask following the equivalent standards (N95). https://t.co/c9LWBZrZrT https://t.co/8sgJOivVxX

We apologise for the delays in baggage handling at Helsinki Airport, and we are working hard together with our ground handling partner to improve the situation. If your baggage didn’t arrive with you, please make a report and we'll deliver it to you: https://t.co/9ywnszjfyA. https://t.co/R9zvev0jko

data.text: Is your trip coming up? As many people are travelling for the holidays, we recommend you do the check-in in advance to get a smooth start to your journey. See also our other tips for smooth travels: https://t.co/T4Ou9Xeze9 https://t.co/nwNTSkhrfW

urls.description: Finland has opened for travel from the EU and Schengen countries. Travel from outside of the EU and Schengen area remains restricted. entity.name: COVID-19: Latest news updates from around the world
entity.description: This page is a timeline of Tweets with the latest information and updates on COVID-19 from experts, journalists, health authorities and other trusted sources from around the world. For more on COVID-19, visit: twitter.com/explore/tabs/covid-19

data.text: Entry requirements to Finland change for fully vaccinated travellers from outside the EU/Schengen area as of 21 December, and you are required to present a negative coronavirus test result not older than 48 hours. Both PCR and antigen tests are accepted: https://t.co/10LbEoil5S https://t.co/01MNU2TSw3

Our new, distinctly Nordic cabin design, complete with a new travel class Premium Economy, brings a breath of fresh air to your long-haul travel. Stay tuned. Launching January 2022. https://t.co/zlWNj9ygBF

data.text: To offer you more choice, we have extended our Nordic Kitchen onboard selection on our longer European flights to leisure destinations. The new selection includes a cheese platter, porridge and pasta snack pot. You can see the whole menu here: https://t.co/c770QMG2Ey. https://t.co/9ygT30FvJF

Mythical Finnish Lapland covered in glittering snow offers you lots to experience. And with luck, you might catch the majestic Northern Lights dancing on the dark night sky. See what kind of wonderful natural phenomena you might encounter in Finland: https://t.co/sNrvmTBB3K https://t.co/fM9LIZuERp

data.text: Are you travelling from Finland to Austria, Belgium, Czech Republic, Greece, Latvia, Lithuania, the Netherlands, Norway or Spain? data.text: Are you dreaming of your next long weekend in Europe? Combine urban adventures with outdoor activities, get to know the many museums of the city or enjoy pleasant weather without the big crowds. Check our five top picks for your next destination: https://t.co/UhG3IkKoe2 https://t.co/bda5Tkpjor

Did you know that by reducing the weight of your baggage by five kilograms, you reduce your carbon footprint by about five percent? Get to know our sustainability actions and read how you can contribute to more sustainable travel: https://t.co/JKUueno1yA

Air traffic @HelsinkiAirport has been halted for some hours due to exceptionally difficult weather conditions. Arriving Finnair flights are diverted to other airports and there are cancellations in departing flights. 
https://t.co/AGaNSg6WMv

Many of us tend to pack more than usual for Christmas and winter travels. We might even want to bring some unusual items with us. Check our five tips that help you and your baggage get a smooth start on your upcoming winter holiday: https://t.co/8jsc8Y2SKv

urls.title: Change your booking flexibly
urls.description: With our updated ticket policy, you can now change your travel dates with more flexibility. Book Finnair flights and travel with confidence!

data.text: We have extended our flexible booking policy so that you can book flights and make your travel plans worry-free. Until 28 February 2022, you can change your travel dates as many times as you wish. After that, you can still make one additional change.  https://t.co/NQN3hfqxdl.

data.text: Along with stunning nature, Finland’s lake district surprises you with satisfying experiences for your tastebuds. Try seasonal dishes inspired by nature, rustic food in a relaxing spa setting, classics in an atmospheric manor house or cosy afternoon tea: https://t.co/XCAsRLbRno https://t.co/tPjIFG6BYi

Check out our tips for the sparkling jewel of the Pacific Northwest: https://t.co/eEODDdjZy6 https://t.co/Ub8UJ2YS2W

In November, Finnair carried 487,000 passengers, which was 472.7% more than in November 2020. The number of passengers in November 2021 was 12.4% more than in October 2021. https://t.co/Udwa0NJDdI https://t.co/iV31ihvyzW

data.text: Happy Independence Day to 104-year-old Finland! 🇫🇮 We are proud to be Finland's flag carrier connecting our northern country with the rest of the world. For us, it is always a great honour and pleasure to bring Finns home from the world and to bring the world closer to Finland. https://t.co/1jxUsqr4dh

urls.title: How to get through the airport faster
urls.description: Save yourself some time and follow our tips to get through the airport with less stress. We recommend thinking ahead, starting from advance check-in that saves a lot of time and effort. The easiest way to check-in is with the Finnair mobile app. When you use the app, not only can you store your boarding pass, but you get real-time updates and other services such as the option to upgrade to Business Class or to purchase your seat assignment.
